Standard Module Arguments

Source: R/argument_convention.R
module_arguments.Rd

The documentation to this function lists all the arguments in teal modules that are used repeatedly to express an analysis.

Arguments

arm_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used as arm_var. It defines the grouping variable(s) in the results table. If there are two elements selected for arm_var, second variable will be nested under the first variable.

arm_ref_comp

optional, (list)
If specified it must be a named list with each element corresponding to an arm variable in ADSL and the element must be another list (possibly with delayed teal::variable_choices() or delayed teal::value_choices() with the elements named ref and comp that the defined the default reference and comparison arms when the arm variable is changed.

id_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object specifying the variable name for subject id.

summarize_vars

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
names of the variables that should be summarized.

strata_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
names of the variables for stratified analysis.

parentname

(character)
parent analysis data used in teal module, usually this refers to ADSL.

dataname

(character)
analysis data used in teal module.

label

(character)
menu item label of the module in the teal app.

paramcd

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
variable value designating the studied parameter.

useNA

(character)
whether missing data (NA) should be displayed as a level.

na_level

(string)
used to replace all NA or empty values in character or factor variables in the data.

denominator

(character)
chooses how percentages are calculated. With option N, the reference population from the column total is used as the denominator. With option n, the number of non-missing records in this row and column intersection is used as the denominator. If omit is chosen, then the percentage is omitted.

avisit

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
value of analysis visit AVISIT of interest.

cov_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for the covariates variables.

aval_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for the analysis variable.

cnsr_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for the censoring variable.

conf_level

(teal::choices_selected())
object with all available choices and preselected option for the confidence level, each within range of (0, 1).

add_total

(logical)
whether to include column with total number of patients.

hlt

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
name of the variable with high level term for events.

llt

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
name of the variable with low level term for events.

visit_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used as visit variable. Must be a factor in dataname.

by_vars

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names used to split the summary by rows.

plot_height

optional, (numeric)
a vector of length three with c(value, min, max). Specifies the height of the main plot and renders a slider on the plot to interactively adjust the plot height.

plot_width

optional, (numeric)
a vector of length three with c(value, min, max). Specifies the width of the main plot and renders a slider on the plot to interactively adjust the plot width.

time_points

(teal::choices_selected())
object with all available choices and preselected option for time points that can be used in tern::surv_timepoint().

time_unit_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for the time unit variable.

drop_arm_levels

(logical)
drop the unused arm_var levels. When TRUE, arm_var levels are set to those used in the dataname dataset. When FALSE, arm_var levels are set to those used in the parantname dataset.

pre_output

optional, (shiny.tag)
with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example a title.

post_output

optional, (shiny.tag)
with text placed after the output to put the output into context. For example the shiny::helpText() elements are useful.

subgroup_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec())
object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used as the default subgroups.

treatment_flag_var

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec)
on treatment flag variable.

treatment_flag

(teal::choices_selected() or teal::data_extract_spec)
value indicating on treatment records in treatment_flag_var.

basic_table_args

optional, (basic_table_args)
object created by teal.devel::basic_table_args() with settings for the module table. The argument is merged with option teal.basic_table_args and with default module arguments (hard coded in the module body).

For more details, see the vignette: vignette("custom-basic-table-arguments", package = "teal.devel").

ggplot2_args

optional, (ggplot2_args)
object created by teal.devel::ggplot2_args() with settings for the module plot. The argument is merged with option teal.ggplot2_args and with default module arguments (hard coded in the module body).

For more details, see the help vignette: vignette("custom-ggplot2-arguments", package = "teal.devel").

Value

module object generated by the teal::module() function.

Details

Although this function just returns NULL it has two uses, for the teal module users it provides a documentation of arguments that are commonly and consistently used in the framework. For the developer it adds a single reference point to import the roxygen argument description with: @inheritParams module_arguments

Contents
